Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Time for HUSH believers to get a sneak peak at our newest HUSHv3 whitepaper: https://github.com/MyHush/hush-v3-whitepaper/blob/master/hush-v3.pdf

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> still a lot more to be added, juicy bits, but y'all need a taste

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 112 files changed, 13924 insertions(+), 4290 deletions(-) with no conflicts. Thank you, merge gods

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> jl777 changed 20K lines since I forked HUSHv3, and we just pulled in *all* of his work (much of which was submitted by various KMD people). This is the reason being a fork of KMD is so strategic and valuable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Akira X> Nice.  Didn't know jl777 also working on hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> Hush3 is using the Komodo base, and by extension jl's code/updates/upgrades as well as its own

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> HUSHv3 is built on the shoulders of jl777

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I made about 10 testnets in the last few days to test stuff, hopefully going to do a final testnet in a few minutes and then pray to the mainnet gods

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Matthias> Great work @dukeleto ! So from an address standpoint, is Hush going to become a fork or a "token" of KMD? i.e. can one send Hush to a KMD address?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Matthias if you own an address on the new HUSHv3 chain, you also own that address on KMD and all KMD asset chains

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> because of how BTC pubkeys work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> your HUSHv2 pubkey can be imported to KMD, that is how you unlock your funds on the new chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> basically, everybody is taking their same pubkey and using that on a new KMD-flavored chain, which is why the address format changed to R....

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is a source code fork of Komodo *and* an asset chain, with it's own genesis block. It's not a chain fork.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> closest similar thing is VRSC

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I wouldn't describe Hush as a "token" because it's mineable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You can take any BTC-style pubkey and import that into any cryptocoin and you will own the equivalent address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it looks different because of "prefixes" that go before the base58() is taken

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Matthias> Ok so if I already have a KMD address, I would be able to send Hush on there?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ComputerGenie - ChickenPool> all R type addressed carry across Komodo and almost all assetchains

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Matthias if you have a KMD address already, you own the privkeys, then you can send to that same address on HUSH. And once you import the privkey to the HUSH chain, you will see those funds
